children.name: node description
children.desc:
The node should be as short as possible, because:
  • it will appear on one single line
  • the graph geometry is calculated based on the longest node

children.name: text file
children.tip: Must be named data.txt

children.name: nodes collection
children.tip: A node is always identified by a few names to be displayed

children.name: tabs indented
children.tip: tabs indentation reflects the level of the node

children.name: images or URL
children.tip:
Additional image and/or URL may appear on consecutive line(s) at exactly the same level as the node.
  • URLs are identified by a prefix http or by a suffix pdf/doc/docx/xls/xlsx
  • Images are identified by a suffix jpg/jpeg/gif/png

children.name: description
children.tip: Each line may (not mandatory) contain a descriptive letter followed by ': ' to identify how to interpret the remaining line

children.name: node
children.tip: [n: ]< node name>

children.name: Sorting level
children.tip:
s:

The sub level nodes will be sorted alphabetically
children.desc: The sub level nodes will be sorted alphabetically

children.name: Grouping level
children.tip:
g:

The sub level nodes having identical first names will be sorted and grouped under that first name in a new hierarchical level on the children level entries
children.desc: The sub level nodes having identical first names will be sorted and grouped under that first name in a new hierarchical level on the children level entries

children.name: URL
children.tip: [u: ]< URL>

children.name: image
children.tip: [i: ]< image filename>

children.name: multiple images
children.tip:
I: < image filename> [< image filename> ...]

The list of images must appear on a single line.
A line continuation < backslash> might be used to split a long line.

children.name: description
children.tip: d: <(HTML) text> (description centered in window)

children.name: tooltip
children.tip: t: <(HTML) text> (tooltip)

children.name: <backslash> to continue on a second line
Conversion
children.desc:
The text file (data.txt) must be converted to a JSON file (data.json).

This task is handled by the script txt2json.

A Makefile is taking care of the conversion (type 'make' once the data.txt has been modified)

children.name: Left of the bullet
children.tip: Clicking the node expand the next child level

children.name: Right of the bullet
children.tip: No more children

children.name: Filled white
children.tip: Children are visible (open node)

children.name: Filled blue
children.tip: Children are hidden (closed node)

children.name: Magenta outline
children.tip: A description is available

children.name: Filled orange
children.tip:
One (or more) image is available
  • < ESC> or < Space> will hide the image
  • < Arrow keys> will move sequentially in a set of images

children.name: <Shift-click>
children.tip: Will close every opened neighbour node
